description:
Was going back to school at night to retrieve a forgotten lunch box a really bad mistake? That's how it seems when Mangetsu Kohinata suddenly finds herself pulled into a strange world where girls in giant magical armor are engaged in a ferocious battle. While the timing was unfortunate, it turns out that Mangetsu's arrival in this strange realm was anything but a mistake, because Mangetsu appears to be a mage herself! Now, with the help of her mysterious new friend Shingetsu, Mangetsu must learn how to summon and control her own giant armor as they fight against other mages in a competition with an unbelievable prize - control of the lost magic that once ruled our planet!

(Source: Sentai Filmworks)

tags.name: Battle Royale
tags.description: Centers around a fierce group competition, often violent and with only one winner.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Super Robot
tags.description: Prominently features large robots often piloted by hot-blooded protagonists.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Memory Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) who has had their memories altered.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

node.description: Formerly affiliated with [Kyoto Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/2/) and [Ordet](https://anilist.co/studio/334/). He was one of the people to follow [Yutaka Yamamoto](https://anilist.co/staff/101655/) to Ordet after its establishment. After leaving Kyoto Animation he primarily used the pen name Gorou Sessha and became well known for his work in the [Naruto](https://anilist.co/anime/20/) franchise. His directorial debut was [Naruto: Rock Lee & His Ninja Pals](https://anilist.co/anime/12979/) which he directed from episode 27 onwards under the supervision of [Masahiko Murata](https://anilist.co/staff/102608/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/oitan125) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/花田十輝)

Jukki Hanada is a Japanese screenwriter and novelist. He is the grandson of literary critic and essayist Kiyoteru Hanada. He formerly belonged to [Takao Koyama's](https://anilist.co/staff/117575/Takao-Koyama) Brother Noppo anime scenario house. He's currently affiliated with SATZ.

He's a big fan of professional baseball and supports the Hiroshima Toyo Carp.

[Official Website ](https://www.aoieir.com/) | [Twitter ](https://twitter.com/eir_ruru) | [YouTube ](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCZ7B1oCEDT_d4c9XTtChX7w) | [Instagram ](https://www.instagram.com/aoieir/) | [Spotify ](https://open.spotify.com/artist/18moNotPmBWa2YZtRnIoZ3?autoplay=true)

Aoi Eir is a Japanese pop singer signed to SME Records. She was discovered through Nico Nico Douga video sharing network. Like other Nico Nico Douga artists, not much of her personal information is revealed.   

Eir has loved singing since she was a child, at high school period, she sung in a band she had formed. After graduating from high school, she gave up her music career but continued performing publicly. Her impressive and beautiful voice are easily recognizable and she has been selected to sing the closing song for TV animation “Fate/Zero” which was released as her debut single called “MEMORIA” on October 19, 2011.

__[Official Website](http://uru-official.com/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCdPCarwi28K5Z7s5l2nMiLw) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/uru_super) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/uru.singer)__

Japanese pop singer signed under Sony Music Associated Records.

__Hometown:__ Saitama City, Saitama Prefecture, Japan
__Graduated:__ Omiya Koryo High School and SHOBI College of Music

[Profile (One Music)](https://one-music.jp/suehiro/index.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kenichiro_s) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/kenichiro.suehiro)

A Japanese pianist, composer, and arranger.
